snippet: A conflict has surfaced between the Guyanese government and calypso singers, who accuse it of repressing their often politically charged music by keeping it off the airwaves.
abstract: Georgetown Journal; conflict has surfaced between Guyana's government and calypso performers, who accuse it of repressing their often politically charged music by keeping it off the airwaves; dispute piggybacks on decades-old ethnic tensions between the descendants of African slaves and those of indentured Indian servants.
lead_paragraph: A conflict has surfaced between the Guyanese government and calypso singers, who accuse it of repressing their often politically charged music by keeping it off the airwaves.

headline.print_headline: Feeling Muzzled in Guyana After Singing Calypsos of Corruption
headline.main: In Guyana, Feeling Stifled After Needling Government in Song
